Álvaro Uribe se destapa: publica manifiesto completo de su “extrema derecha”
El expresidente y senador divulgó 87 apuntes que recogen la espina dorsal de su visión política sobre el gobierno, la justicia, la seguridad y el Estado.

04 Nov 2019, 06:32

El político antioqueño sorprendió la madrugada de este lunes con una publicación en Twitter en la que plasma, punto por punto, la fundamentación política del uribismo en los últimos 17 años en Colombia.
Pero además, es un resumen de sus principales confrontaciones ideológicas y políticas en todos los escenarios del poder en los que ha debatido, con periodistas y contradictores, su ampliamente cuestionado discurso de derecha.
En ese sentido, el senador defiende su política de “corazón firme” con los 8 años de gobierno (2002 – 2010) y afirma que ha sido un político frentero que da la cara a los ataques, los abucheos y las discusiones, particularmente con periodistas.
“Me bajé del status presidencial para discutir cara a cara con algunos de ellos […]. Nunca he pedido un editorial, ni que lo cambien […]. Nunca he pedido que pongan o saquen a periodista alguno”, señaló el senador al comienzo del manifiesto en el que hace alusión a las discusiones que, según él, han afectado su reputación.
“No he retrocedido ante el abucheo o el ataque. He ofrecido el debate que escasamente aceptan”, mencionó Uribe Vélez previo a su defensa al Estado de Opinión que para el expresidente no es otra cosa que “formar, orientar e incluso contradecir opinión pública”.
Partidario de una sola Corte, Uribe se declaró obediente de la justicia, aunque toma distancia respecto del sistema (posiblemente la JEP) que “pretende condenar a un agresor y absolver al otro, por sesgos ideológicos”.
No obstante, el manifiesto de “extrema derecha” divulgado por el líder natural del partido Centro Democrático solo menciona a Iván Duque cuando dice que mantiene la esperanza en su visión “que proclama el equilibrio entre Legalidad, Emprendimiento y Equidad”.
No obstante, la intención del senador Uribe Vélez sería la de responder al aluvión de comentarios sobre el revés del uribismo en las pasadas elecciones y por eso defiende su “extrema derecha” con argumentos en los que, según él, delibera, discute, debate y jamás discrimina.
Eso lo mencionó el senador respecto del aborto en los 3 casos autorizados por la Corte Constitucional y la seguridad social para parejas homosexuales, aunque aclara que no respalda el matrimonio gay, sino “una formalización digna, no necesariamente idéntica al matrimonio de la pareja procreativa”.

Álvaro Uribe uncovers: publishes full manifesto of his “extreme right”
The former president and senator released 87 notes that reflect the backbone of his political vision on government, justice, security and the State.

04 Nov 2019, 06:32

The politician from Antioquia surprised the early hours of Monday with a publication on Twitter in which he expressed, point by point, the political foundation of Uribism in the last 17 years in Colombia.
But it is also a summary of his main ideological and political confrontations in all the scenarios of power in which he has debated, with journalists and contradictors, his widely questioned right-wing discourse.
In that sense, the senator defends his policy of “firm heart” with the 8 years of government (2002 - 2010) and affirms that he has been a front politician who gives face to attacks, boos and discussions, particularly with journalists .
“I got off the presidential status to discuss face to face with some of them […]. I have never asked for an editorial, nor to change it [...]. I have never asked them to put or take out any journalist, ”said the senator at the beginning of the manifesto in which he refers to the discussions that, according to him, have affected his reputation.
“I have not backed down from booing or attack. I have offered the debate that they barely accept, ”said Uribe Vélez prior to his defense of the State of Opinion, which for the former president is nothing more than“ forming, orienting and even contradicting public opinion ”.
Supporter of a single Court, Uribe declared himself obedient to justice, although he takes distance from the system (possibly the JEP) that "intends to condemn one aggressor and acquit the other, for ideological biases."
However, the “extreme right” manifesto released by the natural leader of the Democratic Center party only mentions Iván Duque when he says he maintains hope in his vision “that proclaims the balance between Legality, Entrepreneurship and Equity”.
However, the intention of Senator Uribe Vélez would be to respond to the barrage of comments on the reverse of Uribism in the last elections and that is why he defends his “extreme right” with arguments in which, according to him, he deliberates, discusses, debates and It never discriminates.
That was mentioned by the senator regarding abortion in the 3 cases authorized by the Constitutional Court and social security for homosexual couples, although he clarifies that he does not support gay marriage, but “a dignified formalization, not necessarily identical to the marriage of the procreative couple” .
